intro: Tetranthera insignis, commonly known as the purplestem tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, white to purple flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Tetranthera insignis is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
